data.title: Lucy Robinson on LinkedIn: #womensday2022 #womeninscience
data.meta_description: Women face a lot of the same struggles to advance their careers that men do, and a few extra ones. I remember that I felt I had no choice but to leave research‚Ä¶
data.text:
Ever wondered what those bracket symbols really mean? Let xkcd explain. Happy weekend, everyone! https://xkcd.com/2954/ [Image description #a11y] ( ) Regular parentheses for setting stuff aside. [ ] Square brackets (more secure). { } This stuff is expensive so be careful with it. " " Someone is talking. ' ' Someone British is talking. <> An animorph is talking. ¬´ ¬ª A French animorph is talking. | | I'm scared of negative numbers but these signs will protect me. * *_ _ / / I have a favourite monospaced font. ~~ I'm being sarcastic and I had a Tumblr account in 2014. [([{( )}],)] These Python functions are not getting along. ‚åä ‚åã Help I'm a mathematician trying to work with actual numbers and they're scary. ‚üÜ ‚üÖ Why are trying to read my violin? | „ÄâDon't stop here ‚Äì this is Quantum Country.

And finally Gabriela Bla≈ækov√° & Marcela Hortova-Kohoutkova had 2 posters at 1st European ImmunoMetabolism Conference. Also some popularization for BEATsep Consortium - FricLab - Marcela Hortova-Kohoutkova was out during 2Q 2024: https://lnkd.in/eJZaRrYX WIRED Czech Republic & Slovakia and an interview at Popular Czech magazine ‚ÄûZ√°zraky medic√≠ny‚Äú (Wonders of Medicine) about the challenges of post-sepsis care and how the BEATsepsis project aims to make it easier to identify and handle longterm complications in sepsis survivors. https://lnkd.in/eufjDRTq St. Anne's University Hospital Brno Faculty of Medicine, Masaryk University √östav hematologie a krevn√≠ transfuze lets see what Q3 2024 brings

Are you in the process of looking for research funds or preparing a proposal? Before you get started, take a moment to check out IEL's latest blog on how to increase your chances of funding success, authored by IEL's Director Lucy Robinson! Lucy gives her advice on how to be really slick and efficient in preparing an effective proposal - one that ticks all the boxes of the funder and hits all the right notes. Lucy and the IEL team have worked with researchers based all around the globe for more than a decade now, helping them to secure the funds they need to support their research. And we're proud to say that we have a pretty good record of success ;-) You can find Lucy's blog here, on our website: https://lnkd.in/d3b3RFN3 ...and while you are browsing our site, you could even revisit the three-part blog series authored by IEL's Neil McCarthy. Outside of IEL, Neil is a Senior Lecturer who has recently secured himself some ¬£1.5m in research funding. So, you could say he knows his way around an effective grant proposal! But not only that, Neil has reviewed proposals for the MRC, BBSRC, and Wellcome among others. You can find part one of his blog series, here: https://lnkd.in/dnTgtAeB Happy reading! And remember to get in touch at enquiry@insighteditinglondon.com if you would like to chat to us about your own projects!
